title: Coronation Street's Lucy Fallon calls Bethany Platt sex grooming storyline "disturbing" and admits upcoming scenes made her skin crawl

Coronation Street ’s Lucy Fallon has admitted her skin was crawling after reading upcoming scenes in the sex grooming storyline - and reveals things are going to get even darker on the soap. 
The actress is in the middle of a harrowing storyline which has seen her character Bethany Platt lose her virginity to older boyfriend Nathan, who is grooming her for sex. 
Things will get even more grim in upcoming episodes when Nathan offers up Bethany to one of his friends for sex, and the teenager goes through with it on Nathan’s encouragement. Bethany with Nathan in Corrie (Photo: ITV) Lucy spoke on Lorraine last week about the importance of the dark storyline (Photo: ITV) Read More Why Bethany Platt actress Lucy Fallon HASN'T watched Coronation Street paedophile storyline 
“The storyline is disturbing. It has been really uncomfortable to film,” said Lucy. 
“This week we read through the first scene where Nathan Curtis - Bethany’s much older boyfriend - will pass her on to one of his friends for sex as a favour. 
"She isn’t raped, she agrees to have sex with the guy, but only because Nathan tells her it is normal and this is what adult relationships are really like,” she told The Sun on Sunday . 
“When I read that, it made my skin crawl. It was horrible.” Bethany met Nathan last year (Photo: ITV) Nathan has been slowly getting a grip over Bethany (Photo: ITV) Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Nathan Curtis lures schoolgirl Bethany Platt into his car Share this video Watch Next 
Lucy, 21, has spoken out recently about the importance of the storyline and bringing the dark and disturbing world of sex rings and grooming to a wider audience. 
"She is going to be suffering the after-effects of what happens to her for a very long time," said Lucy. 
"But to me, it is really important that she does come out of the other side so that any victims who might be watching can believe that it is possible." 
Lucy revealed last week she feels “too uncomfortable” to watch Bethany’s situation unfold on screen. Lucy's character Bethany will go through a dark time (Photo: ITV) Lucy pictured at the NTAs (Photo: UK Press via Getty Images) Read More 
She said on ITV's Lorraine: “I haven’t watched it, because it makes me feel uncomfortable. But it’s so important for it to be on, especially at this time, because we’re targeting young viewers watching before watershed. 
“It’s so important to target those people.” 
Lucy and co-star Chris Harper, who plays Nathan, both prepared for the storyline by meeting with a young woman who had been groomed for sex. 
“Nothing can desensitise you to what ­survivors of sexual exploitation have gone through. It’s the most important storyline I’ve ever had,” Chris told Sunday People. Chris Harper plays Corrie newcomer Nathan (Photo: ITV) Read More Coronation Street's shocking child grooming storyline praised by viewers: 'It shows how easy it is' 
“It’s massively important I get this right for them. We want to reach out to people to let them know help is out there, and to tell ­abusers they can’t get away with it. 
“Half the problem is getting people to come forward. It’s been said that for every one ­person reporting abuse, another seven don’t.” 
“The stereotype is of this older man with a sticky suit, bad hair and bad teeth,” Chris added. “But often the reality is very different. The perpetrators could be any age, any colour or class, and so can the people affected.
